segment.source: How to Share Folders Between the Host and the MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Share Folders Between the Host and the MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Share Folders Between the Host and the MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Share Folders Between the Host and the MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Share Folders Between the Host and the MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Share Folders Between the Host and the MED-V Workspace

segment.source: You can share folders between the host and the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: You can share folders between the host and the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: The shared folders can be stored on the following:
segment.target: The shared folders can be stored on the following:

segment.source: An external computer on the network
segment.target: An external computer on the network

segment.source: The host computer
segment.target: The host computer

segment.source: The following procedures demonstrate how to share folders between the host and the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The following procedures demonstrate how to share folders between the host and the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: To share folders located on the network
segment.target: To share folders located on the network

segment.source: Configure MED-V in full desktop mode.
segment.target: Configure MED-V in full desktop mode.

segment.source: In MED-V management, on the Network tab, click Use different IP address than host (Bridge).
segment.target: In MED-V management, on the Network tab, click Use different IP address than host (Bridge).

segment.source: Do the following on the host computer:
segment.target: Do the following on the host computer:

segment.source: In Control Panel, click View network status and tasks, and set Network discovery to On.
segment.target: In Control Panel, click View network status and tasks, and set Network discovery to On.

segment.source: On the Start menu, right-click Computer, and click Map network drive.
segment.target: On the Start menu, right-click Computer, and click Map network drive.

segment.source: In the Map Network Drive dialog box, in the Drive field, select a drive.
segment.target: In the Map Network Drive dialog box, in the Drive field, select a drive.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Ensure that the same drive letter is not in use on both computers.
segment.target: Ensure that the same drive letter is not in use on both computers.

segment.source: Click Browse.
segment.target: Click Browse.

segment.source: In the Browse For Folder dialog box, browse to the shared drive, and click OK.
segment.target: In the Browse For Folder dialog box, browse to the shared drive, and click OK.

segment.source: Click Finish.
segment.target: Click Finish.

segment.source: Repeat step 3 in the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Repeat step 3 in the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Point to the same drive as on the host computer.
segment.target: Point to the same drive as on the host computer.

segment.source: To share folders located on the host
segment.target: To share folders located on the host

segment.source: Configure the folder to be shared with the appropriate permissions.
segment.target: Configure the folder to be shared with the appropriate permissions.

segment.source: From the MED-V workspace, go to My network places and locate the shared folder.
segment.target: From the MED-V workspace, go to My network places and locate the shared folder.

segment.source: From the MED-V workspace, locate the shared folder.
segment.target: From the MED-V workspace, locate the shared folder.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Ensure that both the host and MED-V workspace computers are in the same domain or workgroup.
segment.target: Ensure that both the host and MED-V workspace computers are in the same domain or workgroup.
